website_summaries.verdict: A mid-priced folding bike tire that can tackle most road conditions when riding at reasonable speeds.
pros: Earns praise for how well it handles rough terrain as well as paved roads
Not too challenging to put on a rim
cons: Some defects noted, including occasional faulty sidewalls and treads
Not the most robust tire for speedy rides

customer_reviews.title: Thicker rubber on-center provides a softer ride and better puncture resistance.
customer_reviews.text: I put these on my road bike at the recommendation of a friend of mine who also has some. My original tires were very fast (low rolling resistance) but, a consistent thickness throughout their width, were prone to retain road debris, risking punctures. These tires are more thick on center, which makes them better at resisting punctures as well as providing a little softer ride, which is appreciated. I will say that the softness of the rubber does seem to increase rolling resistance a little, but not significantly. I will gladly trade a little rolling resistance for the extra security of resisting punctures. I'm a casual rider, not a racer, so these were a great replacement.
customer_reviews.author: amznrvwr88

customer_reviews.title: Besides the fact they did not help me with my devil thorn issue these tires to look great and seem to be very solid
customer_reviews.text: I get devil thorns on my route into work. So many infact I gave up on my last set of tires and decided to try out some armored tires. 2nd day into work with these tires, ended up with a flat. Besides the fact they did not help me with my devil thorn issue these tires to look great and seem to be very solid. I was thinking about giving the tires a 4, but they have not solved my problem - not sure if I had the wrong impression with the description and picture of these tires.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond R. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Yep, they're a tougher tire.
customer_reviews.text: These tires are for every day use, not racing. They are wider and have more pavement contact area than racing tires. You can easily see the difference when mounted, they look bigger and thicker. If we were still racing frequently, I probably would not buy these tires. That being said, they give a bit more comfortable ride and are likely better all weather tires. They are not as big or thick as mountain bike tires, so they are fine for street use, and perhaps an occasional well beaten path. We bought the Gatorskins to replace a set of racing tires which kept getting punctures on our paved streets. So far the Gatorskins seem tougher and have not suffered any punctures.
customer_reviews.author: PleasantCreek

customer_reviews.title: Truly puncture resistant and long lasting tires.
customer_reviews.text: I became acquainted with Gatorskin tires on a long road bike session when I kept getting flats with the manufacturer tires my Giant came with. When I ran out of spare tubes a local high school road bike enthusiast helped me out and advised these are the tires most of the frequent cyclists use and I immediately purchased a pair and never had a problem after that. This year I purchased a new Sava Hero 6.0 and once again immediately purchased Gatorskin tires for that bike knowing it is a wise investment. If you ride a lot than these are a must have item!!
customer_reviews.author: DREAM15

customer_reviews.title: Ultra survivable tires, perfect for poor road conditions, rocks or sharp weeds
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I ride our bikes occasionally in Louisiana, where the roads are awful. Potholes, gravel and debris make it a nightmare for normal tires. On one occasion we had one of our standard tires (before upgrading to gator) popped by a brief traverse through grass when the tire struck crab grass. After that, we knew we had to get something more durable. The gator tires survived all the same abuse and lasted much longer than we expected. Haven’t had a flat yet in over 2 years, and riding once every month or so. We really can’t afford to ride with any other tires here, until we move to a location with better roads for biking.
customer_reviews.author: Tango12

customer_reviews.title: Have Gatorskins on the rears of two of my bikes - they do the job.  Fronts don't need this amount of flat protection.
customer_reviews.text: Bike came with some lower-level Hutchinson tires, the rear was getting flats too often, and from just the most minuscule pieces of metal - like just large pieces of metal dust. Now I understand that 90% of my weight with this bike may be on the rear tire, so that's fair that a less expensive tire wouldn't prevent some punctures. But the Gatorskin, knock on wood, that I put on the rear has been very solid for about 800 to 900 miles now. I don't quite feel that I needed a Gatrskin on the front, so I just installed a Conti GP4000 up there a few days ago.
customer_reviews.author: Have Blue

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade from stock 28s
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a bigger tire under me on my road bike. I had used the Gatorskins before on another bike and decided to go for these again. The tire seems 'taller' as measured from the rim to the outer part of the tire than the old Gatorskins but they feel great under me. I can run a lower pressures which really improves ride comfort. Not puncture-proof by any means based on my experiences with my older set but I do think they help. I don't think anything can truly stop a big goathead thorn if it hits your tire right. I would buy these again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Love these tires
customer_reviews.text: I love these tires, at least so far. On my other road bike, I have Michelin Pro 4 Endurance tires. They are light & seem to roll very well, BUT they seem to be magnets at picking up road debris, especially fine wires that cause flats. What is the point of light tires if they get flats all the time? I have over 600 miles on the Gatorskins and NO FLATS. The Gatorskins are pretty light; they roll well, and they don't get flats (at least so far). Kim
customer_reviews.author: Kim L.

customer_reviews.title: No flats or wear after putting 1800 miles on my Road bike so far in 2020
customer_reviews.text: I decided to switch to Gatorskins from the Conti GP 4000 II after experiencing multiple flats on my routes due to cuts and sidewall failure. Many of my routes consist of back roads paved with oil and chip or the shoulders of county roads amidst the debris. I'm very pleased to report that I've not experienced a single flat using these tires and haven't noticed any significant loss of performance or wear. Check them out if you're looking for a rugged light weight tire for your Road bike.
customer_reviews.author: Randy C

customer_reviews.title: Work great but bead too tight
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure the tire will hold up and resist flats very well, but they started making the bead so tight you can't replace it without tools. I've got pretty strong hands, so should be able to change it without tools...but no. It doesn't need to be that small unless you're a bike racer. And ain't no bike racer sportin' Gator Skins, right? We're commuters and weekenders. I had the same problem with other Continental tires. Shopping other brands from now on.
customer_reviews.author: PR

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Trek Domane SL5 Disc
customer_reviews.text: It was finally time to replace the R1's that came with the bike. I chose the Gatorskins and I could not be happier. The ride very smooth and are very well made (in Germany, so no Chinese junk here) and I think they are a big upgrade over the R1's. The grip is better and I think they are a tad faster as well. Also, since I am in AZ I suspect these tires will be way more cactus-proof, if you catch my drift. It's hard to believe anything could be "better" than these for my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: SKalata

customer_reviews.title: Amazon warehouse purchase: exactly as described.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had these tires on vey long but wanted to say that i bought them via Amazon warehouse and they were exactly as described: new, but not in any sort of manufacturer's packaging. Since i put them on several days ago I've rolled over the broken glass and all the gravel that are ubiquitous on Tucson streets. So far so good! Fair warning that these guys are a mutha' to get on so i hope you've got good levers and have been doing your hand strength exercises! An excellent value when purchased this way.
customer_reviews.author: MThings

customer_reviews.title: Pleased right up to having to replace tires.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my cross-bike tires and these 32mm seem to be doing the job nicely. UPDATE: the kevlar bead has started to break down and fibers are now coming loose during rides and fouling my cluster. Update 2: one tire shows signs the sidewall delaminating on both sides. I purchased a replacement and the replacement does not show the PolyX Breaker logo stamped on the tire (hum, perhaps tire in box is not the tire shown on the box) although that logo appears on both the box and the product listing (see it next to the stamped Continental logo). Knock-offs sold as Continentals?
customer_reviews.author: Steven R.

customer_reviews.title: Is this defective?
customer_reviews.text: The tire came with a pair of "fang-like" punctures. Not deep but noticeable. Is the tire defective? I'm wondering whether I should return it. This is my second attempt to buy gator skin tires here. The first time I think the tires were counterfeit. Oddly, they also had fang like punctures. I'm starting to think I'm better off going elsewhere even if I have to pay more.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Brost

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: These tires are durable, I have never had any problem with one except for age. I don't ride to work every day or week, but I ride weekends and put a bunch of miles on the tires. The old ones had some tread depth left but the sidewalls looked stressed, they were probably 6 years old. So these are long-lasting tires in my experience. $60 for the pair could average under $10 a year and I ride about 500 miles a year, 1 penny a mile per tire.
customer_reviews.author: Prince Charming

customer_reviews.title: Fits big on the rim
customer_reviews.text: Fits a little loose on the rim. Popped 2 tubes by it slipping and cutting the valve stem before seeing the problem. I have recently glued it with 3M weatherstrip adhesive glue and it seems to be working well now. Will update later on durability and wear. 9/16/20 update-Looks like these are going to last a long time. 115 miles and almost no wear noticeable. Now if they just don't start splitting I'll raise it one star. Will update.
customer_reviews.author: Gregthefisherman

customer_reviews.title: Grippy
customer_reviews.text: Only had them on for about 140 miles so far, so durability and milage are unknown. They're pretty grippy on wet asphalt, but I haven't really pushed hard. Ride is not as harsh as my last touring tires (Continental Touring Plus). They aren't noisy and I can't really put any value on rolling resistance; I don't notice any change good or bad. So far, I like them. (700c x 28 on a Litespeedosaurus from the late 1990 titanious era).
customer_reviews.author: Moburner

customer_reviews.title: Strong enough for Florida roads
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea what is wrong with Florida roads, but I swear that some tire company drives around at night sowing nails and shards of glass. I had more flat tires in this state than anywhere else until I got these tires. Whatever is wrong with the roads around here, these tires are enough to handle them. I haven't had a single puncture or flat since I got them. I've gone over 200 miles in these without a single problem. They're durable and dependable. Definitely worth a shot if you're having the same problem, no matter where you live.
customer_reviews.author: Abesian

customer_reviews.title: Continental makes a damn good tire. i've owned these before in 27mm for ...
customer_reviews.text: Continental makes a damn good tire. i've owned these before in 27mm for my "urban" commuter bike, but even the 23mm versions are very solid. i've yet to get a flat after 4 months of regular (4-6 rides a week averaging 35 miles per week minimum) riding, and my 27mm versions lasted for 1.5 years of work week rides (9 miles roundtrip, 5 days/week) before i got my first flat. these are well-made tires. a little slick, so be careful on icy/wet areas after putting some use on them. otherwise, great long-lasting tires, especially for road and paved trail riding.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Bullard

customer_reviews.title: Best tires I’ve had yet.
customer_reviews.text: They do indeed seem to be tougher than other tires. The various tires I’ve had before will get cut up a lot faster by gravel and other sharp stuff on road shoulders with my 200 pounds pressing down. These tires have a few cuts in them but not nearly as many as other tires would have by now (about 500 miles of road riding so far). Rolling resistance seems minimal and traction is good wet and dry as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Connor

customer_reviews.title: Good traction. Questionable puncture resistance.
customer_reviews.text: Traction on these tires is very good. Rolling resistance is good too. Overall I like these tires...BUT I'm not too sure about how puncture resistant they are. I ride exclusively in urban environments. Lots of debris. My previous pair of tires were cheap Forte brand. Ran them hard for two years. Never got a puncture. During my first week with the gatorskins I got a puncture flat. It could just be bad luck, but that was my experience. Regardless, the tires are pretty good for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Caspey84

customer_reviews.title: Good tires, cornering issues
customer_reviews.text: These are great puncture resistant tires for training, recreational riding and commuting particularly on roads where there is glass on and near the shoulders. Downside is the rubber is hard and not very sticky, this presents some risk of going down on sharp cornering at speed and on wet roads. The hard surface doesn't have the same "road grip" as racing tires. On my training rides I'm more interested in puncture resistance.
customer_reviews.author: mompantero

customer_reviews.title: These are fake in my opinion. Returned them
customer_reviews.text: I bought these tires and returned them right away. I have rode many Gatorskins, have 2 on my bike right now. These tires did not look like the others or any I have ever seen. Not the tires from the pictures . I would not buy these if I was you, but you check for yourself when you get them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fewest flats
customer_reviews.text: I have been riding road bikes for over 25 years and average 3000 to 4000 miles per year. Century rides and lots of 40 to 50 mile rides with bike club. So far for me these gator skins have lasted the longest and have had the fewest flats. I want durability in a tire and these are the best I have found. I have seen them in bike shops for around $50, sometimes on sale in the mid $30s. The price I found them on Amazon was low $30s.
customer_reviews.author: Russ H

customer_reviews.title: Great tire!
customer_reviews.text: I ride mostly on paved trails and streets, about 1200 miles per year, and these work very well for me. I hesitated at first at the expense (my last set of tires were half this price), but they seem worth it. I have seen complaints about their being difficult to mount, but I had no trouble getting them on the wheels. They also look good, with a subtle pattern on the sides; my original 1994-vintage tires were gumwalls, and these are a nice substitute. I will try to update this review after I have ridden on them for a full season.
customer_reviews.author: A Careful Reader

customer_reviews.title: Say goodbye to flats!
customer_reviews.text: I pretty much swear by Gatorskins. As an avid cyclist (100+ miles/week), I've been riding on Gatorskins for the last seven years after my last set of tires resulted in flats several times a month. I've ridden on Gatorskins through the glassy streets of Chicago, Boston, and Denver for years and they've always held up well. So well in fact, that I hadn't gotten a flat in over a year, and when I finally did (nasty nail that would have destroyed any tire), it took me forever to fix it because I was so out of practice since I hadn't had to swap out a tube in over a year! Definitely recommend spending the money to get these tires.
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: previously i have loved continental gator skin hardshells
customer_reviews.text: previously i have loved continental gator skin hardshells, but before going out for Sat morning ride yesterday I noticed the tube sticking out of the sidewall. These tires were purchased about six months ago, but havent put more than 1000 miles upon them, Quite disappointed in this product, especially as it is a more durable tire than a race tire.Really Conti- what the %$*# hell. I will not buy these again... And for that matter I have stopped buying the Conti 4000s race tire as well. I'd like better customer service from Continental to replace the tire or money back - I feel ripped off.
customer_reviews.author: Anton

customer_reviews.title: Best road bike tire on the market
customer_reviews.text: I used to get a lot flats on my rides to and from work. I researched road bike tires and decided on these. I am very happy with my decision as they have not once failed me other than normal wear and tear. That is their flaw, I go through the rear tire in just 5,000 and 10,000 on the front. I do about 10,000 miles a year, and wish i could get a rear tire to perform like these do and last me atleast a year, but for now these are the best out there for a road bike that isn't on perfect pavement (if such a thing exists).
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Much easier to work with than they used to be
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for the same tires on my commuting/errand running bike, where they served me well for several years, about half of them stored outside in the San Diego sun and the other half commuting through all the road crap of a midwestern winter. Continental has a reputation for being a PITA to get on and off the rims, and indeed I've broken tire levers on them before. This new set was much easier to work with.
customer_reviews.author: bicycledad

customer_reviews.title: Great for hard core Clydesdales
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 220lb rider that goes pretty hard. On paved trails, I corner in the low 20s. I've gone with gatorskins for a couple of years putting 2-3k miles on each set. This time I decided to go with the continental Grand Prix 4000...got 80 miles out of the rear before I blew out the side wall. Nothing out of the ordinary, just my normal hard cornering. The 4000s were defiantly faster than the gatorskins, but just not for my riding style or size. I really need the fully reinforced side walls. Went back to these gatorskins, knowing they're the right tires for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Groh

customer_reviews.title: They Work for My Hybrid
customer_reviews.text: Swapped out my stock tires off my Specialized Sirrus hybrid and these foldable 700x32 tires are so much easier to mount than wire bead tires. They grip the road really well and roll so much smoother. Best part is they saved me almost 1.5 pounds on overall weight of my bike. The pic shows the weight of the bike with the stock tires and then with the Continental GatorSkins on.
customer_reviews.author: Mohawk MikeTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Really good, all-purpose road tires.
customer_reviews.text: These tires have a well-deserved, excellent reputation. Over two years of use with similar mileage (about 17000 miles) I've had two flats. One was after the tire had worn down and needed to be replaced anyway. Other tires I've used have had 3-6 times the number of flats with similar mileage. The back tire lasts about 3000 miles for me. The front tires will last until they should be rotated to the back anyway and a new front tire installed.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great tires!
customer_reviews.text: I am writing this review after just one ride. I road bike the same paved trail (some dirt patches) a few times a week. After I installed these new tires yesterday I could not wait to take them for a ride. After a 3 hour ride, I am happy about how quiet and smooth they are. And it seems they are also more comfortable to ride than my last set. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Reza K.

customer_reviews.title: 5 flats in 5 days
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair last year that did very well. Purchased them again this year, and the front tire has 5 flats in 5 rides. I kept thinking that I am causing a pinch while installing the inner tube but NO. The last two flats are due to holes in the exact same spot, but the tire has nothing protuding there, UNTIL you strech it and see copper colored wire tip. Frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: a

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Had the tire for less than 6 months and put hardly any miles on it (probably 100 miles Max). Riding to work and side wall blew out. I check my tire air pressure daily when I ride so there was no reason this should have happened on a basically new tire. Return window is closed so leaving this review - would be better off buying from REI or a reputable bike company.
customer_reviews.author: Alfrieda Krantz

customer_reviews.title: Not particularly puncture-proof
customer_reviews.text: These tires are definitely not puncture proof. I just received these and had them installed last week. 3 days later, I caught a flat from a dull piece of glass that got lodged into the tire, piercing my tube. I was disappointed because I didn’t have my spare because I relied on the durability of these tires. Additionally, while these tires can be pumped up to 120 psi, please know that you will be every bump and rough pavement while riding. The only thing I will give credit for is the speed. The road resistance is very minimal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great workhorse of a tire, and you don't have to worry about flats!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of riding in Sonoma County, California, and the roads are littered with thorns, broken glass, and even nails and screws. Since putting on these tires and riding hundreds of miles, I haven't gotten a flat, and I can confidently go through patches of glass or debris without worrying "Oh no! Will I get a puncture?" Without that fear, I can go confidently all over without worrying about my tires. These things are bulletproof!!
customer_reviews.author: Paul R. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Tough tire, wears fast though
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like these tires. The only thing I would fault them on is the soft compound, which wears quickly. Put about 4k on a set, and they are starting to fall apart. Not sure if I'm down to the wear indicators, but the tires have divots, and one tire has split. I occasionally take a gravel path, which I attribute to the divots.
customer_reviews.author: mayjalook

customer_reviews.title: Durable Road Tire
customer_reviews.text: I've now ridden these about 150 miles on wet and dry roads. They have handled very well. Some of my routes have a lot of debris and these have held up perfectly. I even had a small piece of wire stick in the tire, but no puncture. I don't think I would use these for anything other than asphalt, but as a road tire they are great.
customer_reviews.author: BR

customer_reviews.title: My favorite tires for commuting
customer_reviews.text: I've been commuting over some of just the lousiest roads imaginable - construction debris, jackoff drivers, gravel and busted autoglass interspersed everywhere. In short, it's a tough route. These Gatorskins have held up admirably. I rode to work 4 out of 5 days the first week I had them installed (oh and installation was easy enough). In the hundred-odd miles I put on them over really garbage roads, I had 2 deep gouges from construction debris. Probably nails. No flats! The rubber was gouged away down to what I think is a kevlar strip. The kevlar stopped the penetration, so I rode on without realizing I had taken a hit. All in all, that's insurance you can't buy.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST OUT THERE..
customer_reviews.text: ONE OF THE BRST TIRES OUT THERE FOR ALL CONDITIONS, TO ME THESE TIRES HAVE GREAT GRIP, GREAT DURABILITY, AND CORNERING, NO TIRE IS PUNCTURE RESISTANT BUT SO FAR THESE TIRES CAN TAKE ALOT . I'VE BEEN A GATORSKIN USER SINCE 1997. AND WILL KEEP GOING STRONG. I'VE PUT 6K MILES ON 1 SET TILL IT FINALLY WAS TIME TO LET IT GO.. DEPENDING ON HOW MANY MILES U PUT PER DAY. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THESE TIRES . 5 STARS 🌟
customer_reviews.author: Victor Valderramos Jr

customer_reviews.title: No more flats - so far!
customer_reviews.text: I was constantly getting flats on my rear tire, a Vittoria Zaffiro Pro, and that tire was beyond difficult to put back on so I decide to try something different. I've got a few hundred miles on this tire and no flats. I know some folks complained about this tire being hard to get on and while it's not easy I was able to mount it on the rim using just my hand. My only complaint is that it's very stiff and can lead to a rougher ride but not so bad that I would consider changing.
customer_reviews.author: J. DFW

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tire choice
customer_reviews.text: Fourth pair of these tires over past few riding seasons. They are not as grippy in turns/wet conditions, nor do they have as low a rolling resistance as other high performance tires used in past, but, for day to day riding...these offer significantly better wear, headache free performance with road debris, and very acceptable ride quality. Very much a 'go to' tire choice for daily training rides and touring.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Great Tires!!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say enough good things about these tires. They ride as smooth as any other tire I have tried. I usually can’t go more than 50 miles with out a flat tire riding on rural roads. I now have over 400 miles on this set of tires and still no punctures. I am extremely happy with the performance of these tire and I will absolutely buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: A. Eksyrg

customer_reviews.title: Noisy but No Flats So Far
customer_reviews.text: These are great tires as far as flat-protection goes but they seem to have heavy rolling resistance and are very noisy. The hissing might drive you nuts or it might be calming. Not really an issue for me just thought I'd mention it. I put them on a 1981 Schwinn Continental with tubular steel 27 x 1 1/4 inch rims and pumped them to 95 psi and away we go. The bike weighs 36 pounds so you might say the bike and these tires are built like a brick shirt house.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Marlin

customer_reviews.title: Living up to the Hype
customer_reviews.text: Great Tire. After experiencing almost a flat a month for a over a year, I finally got smart and looked for a better tire. Reviews were very good for this tire and after riding on them for over 1,000 miles I can confirm the reviews are well founded. Ride on a variety of roads Urban, Suburban, paved trails - potholes, glass, gravel are common to every ride and nearly impossible to avoid. These tires have held up excellently, no flats yet and tread is still holding up. Yes, a little heavier then many tires but not that much and well worth it for the riding I do.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Sidewall blew while the tire still looks new
customer_reviews.text: Sidewall blew with very light use after only a few months. Will not be paying for any more Continental tires. Hopefully Continental honor their warranty because the seller won't accept returns after 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: patrician

customer_reviews.title: Top quality in durable road slick
customer_reviews.text: Love these, Conti products are top shelf Dont let slick tread scare you these grip very well even in rain. For cross or hybrid i use something with side tread for front tire, a pair of these for road is fast and reliable Mounting any new kevlar bead 700c tire Is a terror, i damaged a tube first try
customer_reviews.author: Curt

customer_reviews.title: GatorSkin...? more like PotatoSkin...?
customer_reviews.text: Overrated waste of Money... Brought these... but waited till my old tires needed to be changed ... Big mistake... these didn't last a month before my first flat... not a slow leak but a flat flat... they are overrated... They lied...GatorSkin 🙄 wish I could return but it's too late now...
customer_reviews.author: Kareem Bullard

customer_reviews.title: My go to bike tire
customer_reviews.text: In one word, "Reliable" I've had a pair of these on my bike for thousands of miles now and they're still running strong. After my wife got a flat from a goat head, something that is really common during the summer where we live now, I decided it was time to upgrade her tires as well. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: JustMaier

customer_reviews.title: Failed for me <200 miles.. hopefully you have better luck.
customer_reviews.text: I had my previous tires for over a year. Am a heavier cyclist... but these ones lasted less than a month. I guess I need something more durable. On to the next.
customer_reviews.author: Rob  Maeder

customer_reviews.title: One Flat Tire Per Week With These Tires
customer_reviews.text: I've had these on my bike for about 3 weeks now and have been averaging one flat tire per week. These guys just cant handle what mother nature has to offer here in the southwest.
customer_reviews.author: The James Family of ABQ

customer_reviews.title: Continental Ultra Gatorskin Bicycle Tires.
customer_reviews.text: Great tires, love these better then Specialized Armadillo Tires and get 2x the tread life. Delivery was fast and the price was 40% less then in the main stream bike shops around where I live.I use them on a Cannondale Synapse 3 w/Ultrega components and I use Mavic Krysium SC rims for us bigger guys. I used 700 x23 but when back to 700 x 25mm when ordering these Conti's and much smoother and actually roll faster on these. The Armadillo are pretty hard ride, these are more pliable.
customer_reviews.author: MGS

customer_reviews.title: A good value
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my tires with these based on a recommendation from a friend who is a heavy biker (rides lots of miles). I expect to try them out as soon as the weather warms and the roads clear up. I perceive them to be a good value as I researched several tires before deciding on these.
customer_reviews.author: DGROBBY

customer_reviews.title: I love it when I wear out a set of tires ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it when I wear out a set of tires - means I've been riding a lot. This go I elected to try these Gatorskins and have been very happy with the choice. They only fought me a little bit on mounting and have yielded a smooth ride with good traction. The tread isn't much to speak of and I would be very cautious of riding these on wet pavement - not that I do that a lot. All-in-all very happy with these... and I love saying it for some reason... Gatorskins.
customer_reviews.author: Bill A

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy tires!
customer_reviews.text: These tires were recommended to me by another cyclist as durable, and he was so right! I had cheaper tires that would get punctures and flats if I rode after rain and ran over stickers on the road. But after many months of frequent riding with the Continental Gatorskins, I have never had a flat tire.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: No More Flats
customer_reviews.text: I've had no flats since I switched to GatorSkins a few years ago. As the photo shows, the tire lining is very effective at preventing punctures. The wire poked in through top, but got deflected out the side. I only discovered it when I finished the ride. I'm buying a new tire now because the old one got cut up by a pothole. The sidewall was ripped, but the tube remained intact and the tire held together well enough to get me home. If you ride a lot of miles, you need GatorSkins.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: Went from tubeless to these with tubes!
customer_reviews.text: I installed a set of the 25mm on my XL Giant Contend 1. It’s a very awesome tire! So awesome that I went from a completely tubeless setup to putting these on with a set of tubes. Super happy with my decision, can’t wait to see how these hold up this summer!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Continental GatorSkin Folding Tires
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tires! I'll get down to specific details for my results as a very (VERY) amateur rider. I averaged 14 mph on my 5.5 mile commute to work on a winding bike path riding my entry level flat bar road bike before getting these tires. After installing these tires, I now average over 16 mph for the same ride under the same conditions, and I noticed a major improvement in comfort along with the decreased rolling resistance. Overall, These are one of the best upgrades you can make for a noticeable performance boost, especially for the novice!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Helton

customer_reviews.title: Inspect your tire inside and out before accepting
customer_reviews.text: I received this tire for a new bike after having a flat. I installed the new tire and tube in prep for a long ride. In the morning my tire was flat. After inspecting why a new tire and tube were flat in less than 12 hours. I found a wire sticking out on the inside of my tire which puncher the tube. I had to sand and patch the tire and the tube to complete my ride. I was very disappointed in the quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tire for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great price, easy install. I do notice I feel the road alot more with these. Not sure how to explain it. Do like them for the price Not sure how many miles I'll get. But for the price so far I like them I am a above average rider. Maybe 60 to 90 mile's per week.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Poulin

customer_reviews.title: Sidewall blowout after two months.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what happened to Continental, if they downgraded their product or if I got a bad batch or an imitation, but the sidewall on mine blew out overnight with visible sign of wear or exterior damage. I did not over inflate the tube. Other friends of mine have not had good luck with these recently so I will not be buying more of this product.
customer_reviews.author: E. J.

customer_reviews.title: 000 miles on these tires and they have been fantastic. I upgraded from Hutchinson Equinox II 700c x ...
customer_reviews.text: I have put about 1,000 miles on these tires and they have been fantastic. I upgraded from Hutchinson Equinox II 700c x 23. I kept get getting punctures while riding on the equinoxes so I wanted to upgrade to something more durable. The rolling resistance seems to be a little less since I went to 700c x 25 and still have had no punctures. Highly recommend these tires.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Parents rode about 250 miles before tire got a hole from a rock.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these tires for my parents for their tandem, suppose to be best tire puncture proof. They were on their 6th ride and maybe 250 miles total since putting them on, and they get a puncture from a little rock in a parking lot. Very disappointed. Obviously not puncture proof.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Great Looking
customer_reviews.text: Just a hint of red showing through the sidewall which is really cool with the look of my bike. Any sort of distance though and they are black. They were packaged still in a circle instead of being all twisted together so they went on like a charm. We live in an area with a ton of goatheads on the paths and these are holding up really well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Tubes have been great so far. They've decreased the frequency of flat tires on my commute immensely. I've had only one puncture for the 600 miles since I bought the tires. That flat came from a sharp metal spike, not much you can do about those. I expect that they will continue for quite a while. The mold line on the center of the tires hasn't even completely worn off yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: these are fantastic tires. Smooth ride
customer_reviews.text: Been running these on my road bike now for 6 mos. Bought these after having a season of nothing but flats on Conti Race 23c. I went up to 25c and picked up these tires. Frankly, these are fantastic tires. Smooth ride, great traction basically an upgrade for the entire ride experience. I m not a fast rider so to me, the weight doesn't matter at all, the comfort and increase in smooth ride, well worth the change. So far, the durability seems excellent, I've now ridden on some harsh gravel roads with them and not a scratch. I highly recommend these tires and when they wear out, I ll put on a new set.
customer_reviews.author: T. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great tires and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: The tires are easy to install and even though I haven't put a lot of miles on them yet I can say they roll smoothly and look as if they will be good for many hundreds of miles. So I think they are a good purchase and would definitely buy a set again if and when needed.
customer_reviews.author: D Ray C'ham

customer_reviews.title: better than they look
customer_reviews.text: bought these three years ago, and haven't had a flat yet. people comment all the time about how my tires seem bald, and i tell them that's how they came. i've never had issues with traction or flats. will buy again, if i ever need to.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Bates

customer_reviews.title: No flats!
customer_reviews.text: I am on my second set of Gatorskins and haven't flatted yet. These tires have been great for me. And if I did ever get a flat, they are easy to remove and put back on. You need a tire lever to remove, but I can get them back on with just my hands (and strong thumbs!)
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: 2 flats first week.
customer_reviews.text: I commute some rough territory around san francisco, so I wanted to spend the extra money thinking I'd get extra protection against all the broken glass and debri on the road. Had 2 unrelated flats in the first week, a glass shard and a staple I pulled out of the tire. I would say just get normally priced generic tires and go with tire liners. That's what I used to do before, and am going back to this method.
customer_reviews.author: Karol S.

customer_reviews.title: less pinch flats
customer_reviews.text: I typically ride 4000 miles a year. I like to push the pace. I ride open country roads miles away from help. I don't like flats to ruin my day. I have ridden tubeless, I have ridden race tires... in balance, the Gatorskin's are my favorite. Good handling, good grip, good life span (I typically get 2000 + miles per tire before considering it for replacement). Nothing is perfect but these are my go to tires until something better comes along.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: These Tires Are Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I wish I'd have found these years ago. They roll very nice on pavement. Some effort using the tire tools is required to mount them on the rim but these are very well made tires. I'll be looking at replacing my MTB tires with Continental's when they wear out.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Knows - Usually :-)

customer_reviews.title: I've ran Schwalbe Marathon tires for years commuting NYC and ...
customer_reviews.text: I've ran Schwalbe Marathon tires for years commuting NYC and finally succumb to everyone raving about these tires. They're more supple and feel a bit faster ... BUT they're a pain in the ass to get on (consider this when you get a flat and you will get a flat) first flat came in @ 1000 miles and I can't blame the tires thanks to a well placed industrial staple. However lots of gashes in the rubber compared to the Schwalbe after similiar mileage.
customer_reviews.author: John J Farrell

customer_reviews.title: defective tire, no recourse thru Continental
customer_reviews.text: Gatorskin tire failed in less than four months (internal wire punctured tube). This problem may be an outlier, but when I tried contacting Continental to see if they would remedy, they didn't respond. Buyer beware with Continental Gatorskin tires.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Kagan

customer_reviews.title: but much better than other tires I have used
customer_reviews.text: I have pulled shards of glass and staples out of my tires without flats. These tires usually last me about 2500 miles with only about 5 flats before I decide to replace them. My front tire lasted about 7000 miles with only one flat before it looked a bit chewed up. They aren't bullet proof, but much better than other tires I have used. I am starting to try out Schwalbe Marathon Plus tires since my coworker highly recommends them and says you get ZERO flats with those, but they are a pain to put on the wheel. I weigh about 170 lbs and ride with a pannier bag weighing 5-10 lbs on 700x23 tires on my 2014 Kona Sutra.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to the Gatorskin name
customer_reviews.text: I use these on my daily commuter through urban streets and I've put about 600 or so miles on them so far. I've ridden over broken glass and through construction sites and I haven't gotten a puncture. The size gives great comfort while riding on bumpy midwest roads and trails. The tire recommends you fill to 90 psi but i've gone up to 110 and there still is a bit of sagging while I'm on my bike and I'm only 150 pounds and theres a minimal load. I'm afraid to fill to 120 so I haven't tried that. Overall great tire however, I keep coming back to Gatorskins.
customer_reviews.author: Chase Schulte

customer_reviews.title: so worth the money. It the best or nothing.
customer_reviews.text: I will definitely buy again lol , Continental live up to their name. I know what, I am getting , when I buy from Continental, quality, durability and craftsmanship is what I suspect for Continental. They stand and deliver.
customer_reviews.author: iLovebunnys

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, not impenetrable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a pair of these in October 2016 in response to getting a flat on my second ride. These saw 11 months of use and about 700 miles of riding until the rear one had a flat. Something penetrated the sidewall and made a 7 mm hole and the tire deflated instantly. I imagine they gave me a fair amount of flat protection during those eleven months but I am a little disappointed as I have heard of others going 3,000 miles plus on these without issues. I'll opt for the hardshells next as they are allegedly a bit tougher.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff H

customer_reviews.title: Great value for your $ but not as puncture resistant
customer_reviews.text: Got the 700x25 and it rolls better than my 23 that I had with my bianchi road bike. Apply a little dish washing liquid on the inside edge for easier installation. I had flat tire on the 3rd day caused by broken glass. Not as puncture resistant as claimed.
customer_reviews.author: JD n NY

customer_reviews.title: My tires will last longer than my bike
customer_reviews.text: My OEM tires were showing some extreme wear and when forced to choose between another budget set or "invest" in something top shelf, I sprung for the Gatorskins on the recommendation of a half dozen serious cyclists in my network. I do a lot of city riding, and these have held up flawless to anything urban riding can throw their way.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tires are great, shipping needs a lot of work.
customer_reviews.text: I've ridden Continental since I began biking 10 years ago. Nothing wrong with the tires but when I order two for the next day delivery with prime shipping and only receive one tire, it comes into question why they're even bothering shipping one at a time when I ordered them together. I expect them together. Now I can't finish my bike until the other comes in.
customer_reviews.author: Corinne Nance

customer_reviews.title: Good tire. A little slower than I’d hoped though
customer_reviews.text: Good tires. I recently got a flat with my stock tires on my Giant Contend. These definitely have more road protection than my stock tires. However, they definitely feel slower when riding. In particular when coasting they seem to decelerate quickly. If you are getting them for protection against flats they are a good get, but don’t be surprised if you compromise some speed
customer_reviews.author: Duane

customer_reviews.title: I will order folding tires, impossible to mount
customer_reviews.text: Almost impossible to mount on a carbon wheel. I managed to mount them on Dura Ace, and Reynolds Solitude wheels but still have not been able to mount on my 60 mm Flo carbon wheels. Purchased new areo wheels for my Fuji SST 1.0 and I can not get these tires on the rims. I will ride them on the Reynolds wheels on my Jamis bicycle, and order a folding tires instead. If I have a flat I am certain I will be walking the Jamis home, because I will never have the time nor the patience to unmount and mount these tires on a 60 mile ride.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Don’t.
customer_reviews.text: There are not enough expletives in the world to describe this product. The impossibility of getting it mounted is only matched by the impossibility of removing it. Now I get to take my rim to a shop to get the damn thing off. Thanks for nothing, gatorskins.
customer_reviews.author: jgile

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Durable Tire
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Gatorskin tire that I have purchased and I am extremely happy with them so far. Several of my friends have used them quite a bit and they swear by them as far as durability and not flatting. If they continue to hold up this well, this will be my tire of choice in the future as well.
customer_reviews.author: deblo

customer_reviews.title: Flat on first ride
customer_reviews.text: I was really pumped about getting this tire. This is a real life real riding review. I must have bad luck. First ride 2 miles in on this tire i got a flat and slit in sidewall. My original packaging was cut with a razor but i was desperate and needed a tire asap. I installed it anyway. It did not last and now im stuck tireless!!! Contacted amazon for assistance. Its suppose to have puncture protection! See pics
customer_reviews.author: PlatinumK

customer_reviews.title: Good traction, flat-resistance, nice ride
customer_reviews.text: We use Conti Gatorskin 700-32 on our tandem. The 32s roll very well. We're a light team but can still out-coast heavier teams. We hardly ever get flats. Do read the inflation guidance on the glued-on tag attached to the tire. The recommended 85psi works for us. These are wire-bead tires, not folding tires.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Name is seductive but product lives up to it
customer_reviews.text: I have been riding only on gatorskins for several years now, and I have no issues. Indeed, I (knock on wood) never get a flat. Well that’s not quite true, I get a flat when I figure the tire has been worn out (I change fairly regularly, either once a year or about 1800 miles). If you want reliability this is your tire. I should say that I am a heavy rider (195 pounds) and I run them at 110 to 120 psi.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love Gatorskin tires
customer_reviews.text: I love Gatorskin tires. I ride my trek a lot... But I dislike getting flats, and hate buying new tires. These have lasted me a long time, even with regular riding 3 times a week. Long, i mean over 2 years... with a lot of varying weather conditions, including rides in the rocky mountain passes, snow, ice. The sacrifice is the weight to your road bike. A cheaper set of tires ($30+ from Bontrager) lasted me only about 6 months, and showed tearing and wearing apart treads. Go Continental!
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: May not fit some 700x 23 rims
customer_reviews.text: Be very careful when buying these tires. They are too tight for some rims. If they fit they are good tires. They fit well on one of my bikes but not on another one. I would check the fit at a local bike store before making a purchase here.
customer_reviews.author: P M C

customer_reviews.title: It's hard to go wrong with Continental, and GatorSkin tires are well-regard
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big fan of Conti tires -- and I've ridden over 50,000 bicycle miles on them over the last 20 years; as a brand I'm a believer in the performance and endurance of the Conti brand bicycle tire. I recently purchased my first set of GatorSkin's. After an initial 200 miles of riding on the GatorSkin's, they seem to be measuring-up nicely. They roll very smoothly and grip well. I've given only 4 stars (at this time) ONLY because I have so few miles on them. I'll reserve further judgment until I update this review later in 2015 and once I've ridden the GatorSkin's many more miles.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky1

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: I've used Gatorskin tires for years and these have not lived up to my previous experiences. I have been getting constant flats--like every 20-30 miles. They seem incapable of stopping even tiny pebbles or glass shards, the kind that are common on the shoulder of the road, from penetrating. Easy on and off, so fixing the flats is quick, but I'd prefer a more rigid tire that kept me from getting flats in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Paul Gates

customer_reviews.title: Better protection
customer_reviews.text: Better protection from glass and other objects that can puncture your tire. I bought this tire because I ran over a sharp object the blew my thinner tire right in the middle of an intersection. The 'lip' of the tire (don't know the technical term but the part that fits onto the wheel rim) is strong. Other tires are very flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Pat

customer_reviews.title: Great Tire That Does What It Says It Will Do.
customer_reviews.text: After a few too many flat tires earlier in the spring, I asked some local "experts" what they'd choose....and every one of them said Gatorskins. After a few months on them, I'm happy I took their advice -- no more flats. I will say, that for the 32MM versions that I put on my wheels -- they required some patience and strength to get seated. I actually like that in a tire....but you definitely want to break out the tire levers for this one.
customer_reviews.author: Ranger1

customer_reviews.title: Pain to install the first time but significantly easier after use. Great tire.
customer_reviews.text: These are a huge pain to install the first time on Vuelta Corsa Superlite wheels but after a few hundred miles of use they stretched out just enough to where I can do a tube change in 10-15 mins with relative ease (no tire levers). They have been solid so far and I will probably be buying them again when my expire.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing traction on wet pavement
customer_reviews.text: Very light tire that gives you amazing traction even on wet pavement: I have this on my rear wheel. Just today, I went for a ride in the mountains, and it started raining on my way up on a very curvy and winding mountain road. There was no slippage when going up - the tire held good traction with the pavement. Then on the way down, it did hold the curves quite well: although I was going slower than I would do on a dry pavement, the tire did the job, and I safely made it down hill.
customer_reviews.author: xerox

customer_reviews.title: Best Tire for Winter and General Training
customer_reviews.text: Great bike tire for winter and all-around training. A bit heavy and rolling resistance is okay, but it practically bomb-proof. After 2,000+ miles, I have been flat-free and the tires appear as though they could easily go another 1,000 or more. I don't even bother switching my wheel most of the time when I hop on the turbo trainer because this tire is extremely durable and shows little sign of wear compared to other road bike tires when on the trainer. I will continue to use this tire every winter and for general training because it is affordable, rides well, is comfortable, and nearly indestructible.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Blalock

customer_reviews.title: Aptly Named GatorSkin
customer_reviews.text: Gator skin no doubt! Nothing is penetrating these things. These are the best tires I've ever used! I had the original Giant tires on my bike, and I got about ten flats in twenty five rides. It was basically, sneeze and I'm getting a flat. At the suggestion of my local bike shop, I got these. I've ridden through roads with tons of little rocks, I've ridden over a few bolts, I've now ridden through broken GLASS! NO FLATS! These things are great. It's been about three or four months now, and I've been riding three to four times a week, thirty to forty miles.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: King of the road!
customer_reviews.text: The flat tires stopped completely and my riding behavior has not. They are light, responsive and the 35mm was a nice upgrade in ride comfort from my stock 28mm State Bicycle Co tires. Other colors would be nice but I understand that they were not willing to sacrifice performance for aesthetics. I urban commute on a single speed with this on the rear wheel.
customer_reviews.author: PhunkyDork

product_meta.title: Continental Gatorskin Bike Tire - DuraSkin Puncture & Sidewall Protection, Road Bike Replacement Tire (23c, 25c, 28c, 32c)
product_meta.description: High mileage and puncture resistance team up in this fast-rolling, wire bead road tire from Continental. Made with DuraSkin polyamide fabric to ensure excellent sidewall protection without compromising weight or ride quality. Smooth in the center and grippy on the shoulders, this durable tire provides superior cornering in any condition. Designed for bike commuting, touring and serious training. The Continental Gatorskin wire bead road tire is made with DuraSkin polyamide fabric to ensure excellent sidewall protection without compromising weight or ride quality Smooth in the center and grippy on the shoulders, this durable road bicycle tire provides superior cornering in any condition Designed for bike commuting, cycle touring and serious cycing training
feature_bullets: CARBON BLACK MIXTURE- The Gatorskin, manufactured with a durable carbon black mixture, is as comfortable on the way to work as it is training for road races.

POLYXBREAKER- The polyester fibers overlap during manufacturing, yielding a very dense fabric and minimal space in-between threads, making the PolyX highly resistant to any foreign body without reducing the rolling resistance.
DURASKIN- Sidewall protection coming from the high quality polyamide fabric encasing the core casing of the tire from scuffs and cuts under the worst conditions.
WEAR OPTIMIZED TREAD- Get the most out of your tire with the Gatorskin’s wear optimized tread compound, adding a long service life.
HANDMADE IN GERMANY-Continental has been hand making their tires since 1871, maintaining the integrity of tradition, while evolving with the most advanced technology.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
